info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 6:59PM CDT until April 01 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CLINTON AND BOND COUNTIES IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS...SOUTHEASTERN MADISON AND NORTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS... At 658 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lebanon, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters repored ping pong ball size hail in O`fallon. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... St. Jacob around 705 PM CDT. Marine around 710 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Highland, Jamestown, Pocahontas, Greenville, Reno, Woburn and Mulberry Grove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Illinois between exits 21 and 52. Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 14 and 19. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Illinois. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
